page.title: 08Farming - Friars Farm
page.content: The farm has{an area of 1500 acres around{Morningthorpe.}Activities include the cultivation of corn peas and oil-seed rape, and the{rearing of {sheep and turkeys. }The flock of sheep is made up of{1200 ewes.}North Country ewes which run with Suffolk rams to produce cross_bred.Breeding occurs between October and April and in Spring the lambs and ewes are grazed.Fat lambs are sold for butchery between July and December.Extensive grazing is provided by the former parts of Morningthorpe manor.The farmer is very intent on the conservation of landscape and has planted many trees.{One full_time {shepherd is employed.}Every year members of the public are invitedto a lambing weekend to see the lambs being born and to tour the farm,proceeds are donated to charities.
